Why Use &SHORT_PLATFORM_NAME;
There are many reasons to use &SHORT_PLATFORM_NAME; and below are a few
What you can build with &SHORT_PLATFORM_NAME; is often limited by your imagination. Because of the flexibility that is built into the system, you will be able to create, with little effort, commercial grade applications like the following:
An application that will call hundreds of clients and play a pre-recorded marketing message (electoral campaign, products marketing, etc.)
An application that will automatically call people and warn them of an impending emergency like hurricane, flooding, etc.
An application to reserve a table at your favorite restaurant or order meals like Pizzas.
An application to perform telephone surveys interacting with users automatically
Applications to schedule/reschedule, cancel and delay doctors appointment.
Applications to offer users at the airport, upgrades from economy to business class or alert passengers to special offers
Applications to offer businesses a tool to alert customers to current discounts and special offers.
An application that will interact with major brands (Cisco, Avaya,etc) SIP endpoints. This is great because you are not tied to closed source platform. &SHORT_PLATFORM_NAME; lets you access the source code and adapt your application to talk to anyone using SIP protocol.
&SHORT_PLATFORM_NAME; can also be used to setup a short code SMS business that will allow small and large business to get clients to subscribe and receive marketing or special deals.
>
These are just a few selections of what you can achieve with &SHORT_PLATFORM_NAME;. The next section will explain how you can create simple applications with little effort.
